context: The word 'suure' is the elative case (from what/where) of the Estonian adjective 'suur', meaning 'big', 'large', or 'great'. It's used when something is coming out from, resulting from, or characterized by a big/large/great quality. In these examples: 1) Sales with great foundation (from a great basis), 2) He has a very great character, 3) This is an affair of great importance.
